prologue: ^You are a high school student, just navigating daily life; however, you have noticed pen-like devices throughout the school, and a few of your friends have been using them as well.
^You have heard that they are called vapes, but aren't sure what they do. Take care navigating situations regarding these vapes, and good luck.
Act1Complete: ^End of Story. Time to see the consequences of your actions.
EndingUsedVape: ^You gave in to the pressure and tried the vape near the shed. It seemed fun and everyone else was doing it. Over the next few weeks, you start to feel the effects. You find yourself seeking out Edward and Anthony more often just to get another hit. You feel anxious and easily annoyed if you can't use it, and you've already spent your allowance on a new flavour pod. Later on in life you get highly addicted to these vapes, have continous mental health issues, physical health issues, and alot of your money goes down to vapes.

^Lesson: Vaping is highly addictive, especially for young people, and even just trying it once can quickly lead to a habit that's hard to kick. Giving in to peer pressure can have real, negative consequences on your health and your freedom for your future
EndingAvoidedVapeEdwardHelp: ^You successfully leveraged your earlier offer to help Edward with his homework, cashing in your favour to escape a high-pressure situation. You sacrificed $10 for drinks, but you protected your health and maintained your friendship without giving in. Edward got his help, and you stayed vape-free. Later in life you never give in to vapes and live a relatively healthy life.

^Lesson: Sometimes the best way to handle peer pressure is through clever negotiation or by seeking help from allies. True friends respect boundaries, and your quick thinking helped you avoid a risky choice.
EndingAvoidedVapeExcuses: ^You managed to refuse the offer to vape by making excuses about your "lungs not doing so well" and "screwing them up while running earlier." Anthony wasn't happy and called you lame, but you held your ground and stayed vape-free. You spent the rest of lunch awkwardly talking to the others, but you felt good about your choice later.

^Lesson: Saying no isn't always easy or popular, but your health is more important than what others think of you in the moment. Standing up for your well-being builds self respect while also saving your physical and mental health.
EndingWalkedAwayNoHelp: ^When confronted with the situation, you chose to simply walk away, stating you would "work on your own assignment." Anthony and Edward called you out for "missing out," but you left the area without engaging with the vape culture.
^Lesson: Sometimes the strongest action you can take is to physically remove yourself from a harmful environment. You don't owe anyone an explanation for prioritizing your own safety and goals.
EndingWalkedAwayNoInteraction: ^You initially decided to stay put and scroll social media rather than immediately engaging with Edward. Later, when the note came, you chose to walk away from the invitation entirely ("I will talk to you later"). You successfully navigated Act 1 without getting deeply involved in the social drama or the vapes.

^Lesson: You managed to avoid the conflict entirely by choosing your own path. Being comfortable with your own choices, separate from the crowd, is a valuable life skill and has saved you from negative physical and mental health.
Act1Scene1: ^You arrive at School, slightly earlier than normal and spot your friend Edward milling about. Do you head over to talk to them or simply take some time looking at your phone?

c-0: ^You decide to head over to your friend and see what's up.
c-1: ^You decide to just scroll through social media.

b: ^ what's up, you manage to complete the work that Mr Hudson gave us?
^, what are you doing alone over there? Get over here!

c-0: ^Yeah, I managed to complete the work. Questions 10 and 14 were so damn difficult though!

c-1: ^I will talk to you later, just need to do something right now.

Interaction2: ^In the 2nd period, while your English teacher is teaching the class on the structure of an essay, Edward passes you a note...

s: ^Head to the back of the school during lunch, near the shed,

b: ^ bring the vape pen with you.

c-0: ^Although you may get flak for not bringing the vape, you decide to leave it and head over.
^You decide to discretly slip the vape into your pocket and head over.
c-1: ^You don't know if vaping is as great as it sounds, so you pull out your phone.
^Turns out, a lot of the information Edward stated was false. Vapes turn out to be quite addictive and are harmful to the lungs.
^Although not bringing the vape may lose favour with your friends...

vapeInteraction1: ^Well, that's great, I didn't manage the first two questions! Would you mind helping me out at lunch later?

s: ^Sorry, I have other assignments to complete.

c-1: ^Damn, alright, Imma go see if Anthony can help me.
g-0: ^Oh, right, I have something to give you.
^Edward retrieves a pen-shaped object from his pocket and hands it to you.
g-1: ^It's a Vape pen, Anthony's group uses them all the time, heard they are good for your health, and check this, they are all favoured!
g-2: ^This one is for you, keep it hidden though, the teachers will take them.

c-4: ^Curious, you place it in a discrete compartment of your bag and head to class.

vapeInteraction2: ^Near the shed, I see Anthony, Edward, and a few of their friends chatting while some are vaping.
^Anthony, between puffs of his vape, says:
^, glad to see you. Did you bring the vape?

c-0: ^Great, come vape with us, it's simple, just do this
^His friends are also stating similar things to encourage you :
^"The clouds it produces are so cool !"
^You also see Edward trying out his own vape pen as well
^Sorry, but my lungs aren't doing so well, so I will pass.
^You sure? Or are you a coward?
^Nah, sorry screwed up my lungs when I was running earlier.
^Damn your lame, making excuses, but so be it.
^You spend the rest of the time talking to the others, although

s: ^Hey, Edward, you remember that favour you owe me?

c-0: ^Yeah, you're cashing in on it now? Even though you haven't helped me out yet?
^I will give you a free drink, as well as help with the questions.
^Okay, Alright then, buy one for me as well!
^Successfully avoiding the peer pressure situation, you leave the area and head to the shop, where you spend $10 for 3 drinks.
^Didn't Edward give you one, as well? I told him to.

s: ^I just came here to get Edward and work on the questions Mr Hudson gave us.

c-0: ^Oh, those questions, I managed to complete them so Edward could just get help here.
^On the other hand, you should try vaping; it's simple, just do this
^His friends are also stating similar things to encourage you :
^"The clouds it produces are so cool."
^You also see Edward trying out his own vape pen as well

s: ^Hey, Edward, you remember that favour you owe me?

c-0: ^Yeah, you're cashing in on it now? Even though you haven't helped me out yet?
^I will give you a free drink, as well as help with the questions.
^Okay, Alright then, buy one for me as well!
^Successfully avoiding the peer pressure situation, you leave the area and head to the shop, where you spend $10 for 3 drinks.

c-1: ^Nope, if you are helping Edward, I will go work on my own assignment
^Okay, you do you, but you’re missing out!
^As you walk away, you can't help but feel something off.

VapeUsedIteraction1: ^You decide to try it out, and despite coughing a bit on the first tries, you find the taste great, and spend the rest of the lunch period vaping and talking with Anthony, Edward and their group.
